accounts_accountledger: Stores ledger entries for general ledger accounts used in financial accounting.
accounts_bankreceipt: Records all bank receipt transactions including reference numbers and dates.
accounts_bankreceiptdetails: Contains line items or details associated with each bank receipt entry.
accounts_cashcollection: Tracks cash collection events from parties or customers.
accounts_cashcollectiondetails: Holds detailed breakdown of items or invoices covered in each cash collection.
accounts_financialyear: Defines the start and end dates of financial years used in accounting.
accounts_fyinvoicesequencenumber: Manages sequential numbering of invoices per financial year.
accounts_glbanksubledger: Sub-ledger entries related to bank accounts under the general ledger.
accounts_glcode: Master list of general ledger account codes and their descriptions.
accounts_glpartysubledger: Sub-ledger for transactions linked to specific parties under GL accounts.
accounts_journalvoucherheader: Header information for journal vouchers used in manual accounting entries.
accounts_journalvoucheritems: Line items of journal vouchers detailing debit/credit accounts and amounts.
accounts_partyaccountledger: Ledger tracking all financial transactions with a specific party/customer.
accounts_partyaccountledgerdetails: Detailed transaction records supporting the party account ledger.
accounts_partydeposit: Records deposits received from or made to parties.
accounts_partyprvsysclosingbalance: Stores previous system closing balances for parties during migration.
accounts_partyturnover: Summarizes party transaction turnover over a period.
accounts_sequencenumbers: Manages sequence numbers for various document types like vouchers or receipts.
auth_group: Django auth system table storing user groups.
auth_group_permissions: Maps permissions to user groups in Django.
auth_permission: List of all system permissions defined in Django.
auth_user: Core Django user table storing user credentials and basic info.
auth_user_groups: Associates users with groups in Django.
auth_user_user_permissions: Maps individual user permissions in Django.
authtoken_token: Stores API authentication tokens for users.
django_admin_log: Logs admin actions performed in the Django admin interface.
django_content_type: Maps models to content types in Django’s permission system.
django_migrations: Tracks database migrations applied by Django.
django_session: Stores user session data for web requests.
inventory_address: Stores address records linked to entities like parties or plants.
inventory_city: Master list of cities used in addresses.
inventory_district: Master list of districts used in address hierarchies.
inventory_gstin: Stores GSTIN (Goods and Services Tax Identification Number) for parties.
inventory_gstin_other_tax: Maps GSTIN to other tax-related details (older version).
inventory_gstinothertax: Current table for mapping GSTIN to other tax attributes.
inventory_pages: List of application pages or views in the system.
inventory_pin: Master list of postal/PIN codes used in addresses.
inventory_reportlist: Defines available reports in the inventory or ERP system.
inventory_rolepages: Maps user roles to accessible pages in the application.
inventory_roles: Master list of user roles in the system.
inventory_state: Master list of states used in address data.
inventory_userroles: Associates users with roles in the system.
inventory_village: Master list of villages used in address hierarchies.
marketing_accounts: Stores financial accounts specific to marketing operations.
marketing_cart: Temporary storage of products selected by users during order creation.
marketing_cashpaymentdetails: Details of cash payments linked to marketing transactions.
marketing_cashpayments: Header records for cash payments in marketing.
marketing_creditnote: marketing_creditnote stores the header-level information for each credit note, including a unique credit_note_num, the total_value, total_gst, and total_amount being credited. It references the associated invoice_id and dispatch_id, identifies the party_id receiving the credit, and captures the credit_reasons and note_type (e.g.,Credit). It also supports GST e-invoicing compliance with fields like irn (Invoice Reference Number), ack_no, ack_date, and signed_qr. Cancellation details (is_cancelled, cancel_date, etc.) allow for audit and reversal handling
marketing_creditnoteitems: marketing_creditnoteitems contains the line-item details of the credit note, breaking down the credited amount by product_id. Each item includes the price, qty, pre-GST amount, applicable tax rates (cgst_rate, sgst_rate, igst_rate), gst_amount, and final total_amount. The credit_note_type (e.g., Leakage) indicates the reason at the item level.
marketing_dispatchitems: Tracks items included in a dispatch or delivery.
marketing_gatepass: Records gate passes issued for goods movement.
marketing_invoice: The marketing_invoice table stores comprehensive details of sales invoices generated for customer orders. Each invoice is uniquely identified by an id and includes an invoice_num (often with an optional invoice_prefix) and the invoice_date indicating when it was issued. The invoice is linked to a specific customer via billing_to_id, and to the associated dispatch record through dispatch_id. Addresses for shipment are captured via shipping_from_id and shipping_to_id, while logistical metadata like distance may support freight or route planning. The table fully supports Indian GST e-invoicing compliance through fields such as irn (Invoice Reference Number), ack_no, ack_date, and a digitally signed_qr code. It also includes e-Way Bill details (ewb_no, ewb_date, ewb_valid_till) for goods transportation compliance. Financial summaries are recorded as total_value (pre-GST), total_gst, total_amount (inclusive of taxes), and tcs_amount (Tax Collected at Source, if applicable). The payment_status (e.g., Paid) reflects the current settlement state, and robust cancellation tracking is provided via is_cancelled, cancel_date, cancel_reason, and cancel_remark. Audit fields (created_by_id, created_date, etc.) ensure full traceability of invoice creation and modifications.
marketing_invoiceitems: The `marketing_invoiceitems` table contains the **line-item details of each product included in a sales invoice**. Each record is linked to a parent invoice via `invoice_id` and references a specific `product_id`. It captures the sold `qty` and unit `price`, along with the applicable tax rates—`cgst_rate`, `sgst_rate`, and `igst_rate`—which determine the GST composition based on the transaction type (intra-state or inter-state). The table also supports promotional logic through fields like `is_offer_flag` (indicating if the item is part of an offer), `is_same_product` (used in Buy X Get X schemes), `main_order_product_id` (linking offer items to their triggering product), and `offer_qty` (quantity given as a free or discounted offer). Additionally, `tcs` (Tax Collected at Source) is stored at the item level if applicable. This granular structure ensures accurate billing, tax calculation, and offer tracking per invoice.
marketing_orderdispatches: The `marketing_orderdispatches` table records **dispatch events linked to customer orders**, capturing when and how an order was prepared for delivery. Each dispatch is assigned a unique `dispatch_no` and timestamped with `date`. It is directly associated with a specific sales order via `order_id` and linked to a `truck_loading_id`, which connects it to logistics and transportation planning. The financial summary includes `total_value` (pre-GST order value), `total_gst`, and `total_amount` (inclusive of taxes), ensuring alignment with invoicing. Weight and quantity metrics are tracked in detail: `order_weight` reflects the total weight originally ordered, while `total_dispatch_weight` and `total_dispatch_qty` indicate the actual dispatched quantities; similarly, `total_offer_weight` and `total_offer_qty` capture any free or promotional items (e.g., from Buy X Get Y schemes) included in the dispatch. Audit fields (`created_by_id`, `created_date`, etc.) maintain a history of record creation and updates. This table bridges sales, warehouse, and logistics operations by documenting what was shipped, when, and in what context.
marketing_orderdispatchofferitemscrate: The `marketing_orderdispatchofferitemscrate` table tracks **crate-level details for promotional (offer) items included in a dispatch**. It records the `total_offer_qty`—the quantity of free or discounted product given as part of a promotional scheme—and the corresponding `total_crate_qty`, which indicates how many crates were used to pack that offer quantity. Each record is linked to a specific dispatch via `dispatch_id` and identifies the `product_id` of the offer item. This table supports logistics and inventory reconciliation by capturing how promotional items are physically packed and dispatched alongside regular order items, ensuring accurate crate accounting and delivery verification.
marketing_orderitems: The `marketing_orderitems` table stores **detailed line-item information for each product in a customer order**. Each record is linked to a specific `order_id` and `product_id`, capturing the ordered quantity in the `count` field and the applicable `item_price`. Tax rates—`cgst_rate`, `sgst_rate`, and `igst_rate`—are recorded to support accurate GST calculation based on the transaction’s nature (intra- or inter-state). The table also manages **promotional logic**: `is_offer_flag` indicates if the item is an offer (e.g., free product), while `offer_qty` specifies the promotional quantity; `main_order_product_id` links offer items to the qualifying product. Fields like `is_having_offer`, `is_offer_eligible`, and `is_same_product` support complex scheme logic (e.g., “Buy X Get X” vs. “Buy X Get Y”). The `balance_count` tracks undelivered or pending order quantities, and `no_of_crates` records how many crates are needed for this item. Weight tracking is handled via `order_item_weight` (weight of ordered product) and `offer_item_weight` (weight of promotional items). Together, these fields enable precise order fulfillment, offer application, logistics planning, and partial dispatch handling.
marketing_orderpayments: The marketing_orderpayments table records payment transactions linked to customer orders and invoices. Each entry captures the amount_paid, payment_mode (e.g., COD for Cash on Delivery), and exact payment_date. For digital payments, fields like UPI_id, UPI_transaction_id, and UPI_transaction_status store UPI-specific details, while bank_name and bank_transaction_id support other electronic payment methods. The confirmation_status (e.g., Confirmed, Approved, Cancelled) indicates whether the payment has been verified, and reconciliation_flag marks if it has been reconciled with bank or ledger records. Payments can be tied to an invoice_id, order_id, and party_id for full traceability. The collected_by_id identifies the staff member who collected the payment (if applicable), and voucher_no provides an internal reference (e.g., a cash receipt number). Additional flags like towards_previous_system_balance indicate if the payment settles legacy dues, and cash_submitted tracks whether physical cash has been handed over for accounting. Audit fields (created_by_id, created_date, etc.) and optional remark ensure transparency and compliance in financial operations.
marketing_orders: The `marketing_orders` table serves as the **central header record for customer sales orders**, capturing essential metadata and financial summaries. Each order is uniquely identified by an `id` and assigned a human-readable `order_num` (optionally prefixed by `order_prifix`). The `order_date` records when the order was placed, and `delivery_required_on` specifies the requested delivery date. The `order_status` (e.g., Completed) reflects its fulfillment state, while `payment_status` (e.g., Paid) tracks financial settlement. Orders are linked to a specific customer via `party_id` (of type `party_type`, typically SalePartyMaster) and associated with a delivery `address_id`. The sale configuration includes `sale_type` (e.g., Regular) and optional `shift_id` for time-based operations. Financial details include `total_value` (pre-GST), `total_gst`, and `total_amount` (inclusive of taxes). The table also tracks promotional components through `total_offer_qty` and `total_offer_weight` versus `total_order_qty` and `total_order_weight`. Additional fields indicate whether the order was placed via mobile (`order_placed_through_mobile`), if it was forcibly cancelled (`force_cancelled`), or if it originated from a non-registered lead (`prospective_customer`). Audit fields (`created_by_id`, `created_date`, etc.) ensure full traceability of order lifecycle events.
marketing_parentaccount: Hierarchical parent accounts used in marketing financial tracking.
marketing_partycrateledger: Tracks crate deposits and returns for each party.
marketing_salesummary: Aggregated sales data by period, party, or product.
marketing_salesummarydetails: Detailed breakdown supporting sales summary records.
marketing_settings: System-wide configuration settings for the marketing module.
marketing_shift: Defines work shifts for sales or dispatch operations.
marketing_transporter: Master list of transporters used for goods delivery.
marketing_truck: Master list of trucks available for transportation.
marketing_truckloading: Records loading details of orders onto trucks.
organization_employeemaster: Master data of employees including personal and job details.
organization_fuelpriceentry: Logs historical fuel price entries for cost tracking.
organization_fuelrequisition: Tracks fuel requisitions by department or vehicle.
organization_orgplantbankaccount: The organization_orgplantbankaccount table stores bank account details associated with a specific plant under an organization. Each record includes essential banking information such as bank_name, bank_acc_no, holder_name, ifsc_code, and branch. The is_default flag indicates whether this account is the primary/default account for the plant, while is_active controls its current usability. The is_payu_bank_account field specifies if the account is linked to PayU (or a similar payment gateway) for digital transactions. The table supports multi-plant and multi-organization setups via org_id and plant_id, and includes full audit tracking through created_by_id, created_date, updated_by_id, and updated_date.
organization_petrolpump: Master list of petrol pumps linked to the organization.
organization_plant: Master list of manufacturing or operational plants.
organization_route: The organization_route table defines delivery routes within a plant or operational unit. Each route has a unique code and descriptive name, and is linked to a specific plant_id. The is_active flag indicates whether the route is currently operational. Key operational parameters include order_cutoff_time (deadline for order placement), crate_capacity (maximum crates the route can handle), and is_pay_later_allowed (controls credit eligibility for parties on this route). The is_route_started flag may indicate whether the route has begun operations (e.g., for daily dispatch). Additionally, latest_price_update tracks the most recent time route-specific product pricing was refreshed. Audit fields capture creation and modification history.
organization_routesalesperson: Maps salespersons to specific delivery routes.
party_newpartycontact: The party_newpartycontact table functions as a lead or inquiry capture log for new potential parties (e.g., prospective customers or distributors). It records basic contact information including the party_name, mobile_NO, and state_id (linking to a state master), along with a timestamp (date) indicating when the contact was registered. This table likely supports onboarding workflows by storing preliminary data before a full party_partymaster record is created. It does not include detailed business or compliance information, suggesting its use in initial engagement or telemarketing follow-ups.
party_partymaster: The party_partymaster table serves as the central master record for all parties (e.g., customers, distributors, retailers) in the system. It captures comprehensive details including party identification (code, party_name), contact information (email, phone, mobile_NO), business attributes (party_type, annual_turnover, distributes_milk, distributes_byProd), and compliance-related data such as PAN, AADHAR, FSSAI, GSTIN, and bank account details. The table also tracks operational settings like COD allowance, order locking, TCS applicability, IGST usage, and pay-later permissions. Additional fields manage security deposits, crate balances, blocking status (with reason), and links to route, GST, and user accounts. Audit metadata (created_by_id, updated_date, etc.) and document references (aadhar_doc, pan_doc, agreement_signed_doc) support compliance and onboarding workflows. This table is foundational for sales, credit, logistics, and regulatory operations.
party_partysalesperson: The party_partysalesperson table establishes a relationship between parties (e.g., customers or retailers) and their assigned salespersons. Each record links a party_id to a sales_person_id, indicating which sales representative is responsible for that party. The from_date specifies when this assignment became effective, and the is_active flag controls whether the association is currently valid. This enables route planning, performance tracking, and targeted communication. Full audit history is maintained via created_by_id, created_date, updated_by_id, and updated_date.
product_deal: The product_deal table manages marketing or promotional deals associated with specific product categories. Each deal has a descriptive heading, an optional promotional image (deal_img), and an is_active flag to control its visibility or applicability. The deal is linked to a product category via category_id, enabling category-level promotions (e.g., “Festival Offer on Shrikhand”). This table supports frontend displays like banners or offer carousels and helps drive targeted sales campaigns by highlighting active deals for specific product groups.
product_gstslabs: The product_gstslabs table defines the standard GST tax slabs used across the system. Each slab has a descriptive name (e.g., GST - 5%) and specifies the total GST rate along with its breakdown into CGST (Central GST), SGST (State GST), and IGST (Integrated GST) components. This table serves as a reference for applying the correct tax rates during invoicing, order processing, and financial reporting, ensuring compliance with Indian GST regulations. The rates are stored as decimals (e.g., 0.050 for 5%) to support precise tax calculations.
product_hsn_sac_gst: The product_hsn_sac_gst table serves as a mapping between HSN (Harmonized System of Nomenclature) or SAC (Services Accounting Code) codes and applicable GST rates. Each record contains a unique hsn_sac_code, a flag (hsn_sac_flag) indicating whether the code pertains to goods (HSN) or services (SAC), and a reference (gstRate_id) to the corresponding GST tax rate (e.g., 5%, 12%, etc., defined in a related GST rate master table). This linkage ensures accurate tax calculation and compliance during invoicing, sales, and reporting for products or services based on their standardized classification codes.
product_partypopularproducts: The product_partypopularproducts table tracks which products are frequently or preferentially purchased by a specific party (e.g., customer or retailer). It establishes a many-to-many relationship between parties (party_id) and products (product_id), enabling the system to identify popular or recommended items per party for purposes such as sales analytics, targeted promotions, inventory planning, or personalized ordering interfaces.
product_partyspecialrates: The product_partyspecialrates table stores customized pricing agreements between specific parties (e.g., customers or retailers) and products. It defines a special_rate for a given product_id applicable exclusively to a particular party_id, effective from the special_rate_set_date. The special_rate_flag indicates whether the special rate is currently in use for that party–product combination (e.g., YES or NO), while is_active controls the overall validity of the record. This enables tailored pricing strategies such as volume discounts, loyalty pricing, or promotional rates for select customers. Full audit history is maintained through created_by_id, created_date, updated_by_id, and updated_date.
product_product: The `product_product` table is the central master table that stores detailed information about each sellable product in the system. Each product is uniquely identified by an `id` and has a user-friendly `name` and optional `description`. It includes packaging specifications such as `packing_qty`, `packing_type`, and `packing_uom` (unit of measure for packaging), along with `order_uom` that defines how the product is ordered (e.g., in kilograms or liters). For bulk handling, `multipack_qty` and `multipack_uom` indicate how individual units are grouped (e.g., 8 boxes per crate). The table links to its category via `category_id` and to tax-related data through `product_hsn_id` (for HSN/SAC codes) and `transportation_sac_code_id`. Additional operational fields include `min_order_qty` (minimum quantity allowed per order), `increment_order_qty` (order quantity must be a multiple of this value), and `no_of_pieces` (total count of individual items in a multipack). Product status (`status`) controls availability (Active/Inactive), while `product_for` distinguishes product types (e.g., Regular). The table also supports enterprise integration with a `sap_code`, tracks ownership via `organization_id` and `plant_id`, and includes audit fields (`created_by_id`, `created_date`, etc.). A `product_img` field stores the path to the product’s image for display in apps or reports. This structure enables precise inventory, sales, and tax management across routes, parties, and plants
product_productcategories: The `product_productcategories` table defines a hierarchical structure for organizing products into categories and subcategories. Each category has a unique `code` and `name`, a hierarchical `level`, and an optional `parent_id` to support multi-level nesting (e.g., “MILK” → “TONED MILK”). It includes metadata such as HSN code for taxation, inventory prefix (`invprefix`), group type (`grouptype`), display settings (`display_priority`, `display_explore_new`), and image reference (`categories_img`). Categories can be scoped to a specific `organization_id` and `plant_id`, allowing for multi-plant or multi-organization setups. The `status` field controls whether a category is active or inactive, making it useful for dynamic catalog management in reports and frontend displays.
product_productoffers: The product_productoffers table defines promotional offers or incentive schemes linked to product purchases. It specifies that when a customer buys a certain quantity (sale_qty) of a sale_product_id (or products in a sale_product_category_id) in a given unit of measure (sale_uom), they receive a bonus or discounted quantity (scheme_qty) of another product (scheme_product_id) or category (scheme_product_category_id) in a specified unit (scheme_uom). These offers can be scoped to specific parties (party_id), routes (route_id), or applied universally if those fields are null. Each offer includes validity dates (start_date, end_date), activation status (is_active), and audit metadata. This enables targeted marketing campaigns such as Buy X, Get Y at the party or route level.
product_productprice: The product_productprice table stores the standard or default pricing information for each product in the system. It records the default_price associated with a specific product_id, along with the price_set_date indicating when this price became effective. The is_active flag determines whether this price is currently applicable. This table serves as the baseline product pricing reference—used when no route-specific, party-specific, or promotional pricing (e.g., from product_routeproductprices, product_partyspecialrates, or product_productoffers) overrides it. The table also includes full audit metadata (created_by_id, created_date, updated_by_id, updated_date) to track who created or modified the record and when.
product_routeproductprices: The product_routeproductprices table stores route-specific pricing for products. It defines the price of a product (route_price) that applies to a particular delivery or sales route (route_id). This price is effective from a given price_set_date and remains active based on the is_active flag. Parties (Party Masters) associated with the route will be charged this route-specific price when purchasing the product. The table also tracks creation and modification metadata through created_by_id, created_date, updated_by_id, and updated_date.
